document.docTitle: Dendrobaena retrosella Szederjesi & Csuzdi, 2012, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: New and little known earthworm species from Greece (Oligochaeta: Lumbricidae, Acanthodrilidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New and little known earthworm species from Greece (Oligochaeta: Lumbricidae, Acanthodrilidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype .
HNHM / 15914 adult.
No. 15
, Trikala County, Lakmos Mts., Chaliki, open torrent and brook, and rocky subalpine grassland N of the village, 1225m ,
N 39 ° 41.908 ’
E 21 ° 11.037 ’
, leg. J. Kontschán, D. Murányi, T. Szederjesi, Zs. Ujvári, 0 9 .0 5.2011 .

Paratype .
HNHM / 15915 one adult ex., locality and date same as that of the holotype .
Derivatio nominis. From Latin (retro = backward, sella = saddle), referring to the backward displaced position of the clitellum.

Diagnosis. Length 35–37 mm , diameter 3 mm , setae distant. Pigmentation red-violet. First dorsal pores 5 / 6 . Clitellum on 29–36 , tubercles 31 – 1 /n 34 . Male pore on 15 , large. Nephridial pores regularly alternate between b and above d . Three pairs of vesicles in 9, 11, 12 ; spermathecae
9 / 10 – 10 / 11
in d . Calciferous glands with well-developed diverticula in 11, 12. Hearts in segments 7–10 , nephridial bladders sausage-shaped.

External characters.
Holotype
35 mm long and 3 mm wide; number of segments 107 .
Paratype
37 mm long and 3 mm wide; number of segments 145 . Colour red-violet, especially dark on dorsum. Prostomium epilobous ½ closed. First dorsal pore in intersegmental furrow 5 / 6 . Setae distant. Setal arrangement behind clitellum: aa : ab : bc : cd : dd = 1.3 : 1 : 1.2 : 1.1 : 2.4 . Male pore large on 15 , between setae b–c , surrounded by a glandular crescent. Nephridial pores regularly alternate between setal line b and above d . Clitellum on segments 29–36 , tubercula pubertatis on segments 31 – 1 /n 34 (
Fig. 2
). Genital papillae surround setae a, b on segments 9, 28.

Internal characters. All septa membraneous. Testes and funnels free, paired in segments 10–11 . Seminal vesicles present in 9, 11 and 12 , small in segment 9 . Spermathecae two pairs, clearly stalked in 9 /10, 10/ 11 with external openings in setal line d . Calciferous glands with well-developed diverticula in 11, 12. Paired hearts in segments 7–10 . Nephridial bladders simple, sausage-shaped. Crop in segments 15–16 , and gizzard in segments 17–18 . Typhosolis simple, lamelliform. Longitudinal muscle layer of pinnate type .

Remarks. The main characteristic of the new species is the backward shift of the clitellum. The same phenomenon can be observed in three other Greek
Dendrobaena
species,
D. epirotica
Zicsi & Michalis, 1993
,
D. pindonensis
Zicsi & Michalis, 1993
and
D. mahnerti
Zicsi, 1974
, as well as in the Turkish
D. bruna
Omodeo & Rota, 1989
and in
D. zicsii
Karaman, 1973
described from Serbia . The differences between the above-mentioned species are summarized in
Table 2
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Main characteristics of the Balkanic-Anatolian
Dendrobaena
species with clitellum shifted backward.

sp. nov.
